holidays.name: Croissant Day
holidays.description: A delicious day dedicated to celebrating the flaky, buttery croissant, one of France’s most iconic pastries.
holidays.origin: This unofficial food holiday originated among pastry enthusiasts and bakeries to honor the croissant’s rise as a beloved breakfast staple worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Despite its association with France, the croissant’s shape is said to be inspired by the Islamic crescent and traces back to Austria!

holidays.name: National Inane Answering Message Day
holidays.description: A quirky day encouraging people to have fun with their voicemail and answering machine messages by recording silly, odd, or downright inane greetings.
holidays.origin: This unofficial holiday emerged from the office culture of the early 2000s, poking fun at the routine nature of answering messages.
holidays.funFact: Some people use this day to prank friends or coworkers with hilariously cryptic or bizarre voice messages.

holidays.name: Backward Day
holidays.description: A day to turn the world upside down by wearing your clothes backward, walking backward, and confusing your routine!
holidays.origin: Started in the 1980s as a whimsical way to break the monotony and encourage playful reversal of norms.
holidays.funFact: People celebrate by even saying words backward or eating dessert before dinner!

holidays.name: Celebrate Your Unique Talent Day
holidays.description: A day to proudly showcase whatever weird, wonderful, or downright strange talent you have – from toe-wiggling to spoon bending!
holidays.origin: Created to boost self-confidence and celebrate individuality, this day reminds us everyone’s unique abilities deserve recognition.
holidays.funFact: There are contests held around the world on this day featuring utterly bizarre talents you didn’t know existed!
